text.section: The members of the Judicial Retirement and Removal Commission to be selected from among the Judges of the Court of Appeals, the Circuit Judges, and the District Judges, shall be selected according to rules promulgated by the Supreme Court.
The member of the commission to be appointed by the governing body of the bar shall be appointed according to rules promulgated by the Supreme Court.
The members of the commission appointed by the Governor shall include one (1) person from each of the two (2) political parties of the Commonwealth having the largest number of registered voters.
All members of the commission shall serve until their successors are elected or appointed, as the case may be.

law.history: Amended 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 14, sec. 9. -- Created 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 68, sec. 1.
